Descriptive Lists:
This is the Kepler-77 .
The star Kepler-77 islocated about 1859.1 light-years (570.0 pc) away from our Solar System. The star Kepler-77 has apparent magnitude of 15.0, with absolute magnitude of 6.2. It is 0.9 times more massive and 1.0 times bigger compared with our Sun. The surface temperature is 5520 with its spectral types of G5 V Number of Extrasolar Planets    : 1  

Name of the 1 Planet    Kepler-77 b radius 0.960000 mass 0.430000 orbital distance 0.045010 




 (Illustration of the Kepler-77's Planetary System)











 The Star Kepler-77 's habitable zone is located at the following distance 


Inner Boundary (the orbital distance at Venus's Equivalent Radiation )
 : 0.654 AU ( 97762311.7 km) 

Earth Boundary (the orbital distance at Earth's Equivalent Radiation)
 : 0.903 AU ( 135133063.2 km) 

Outer Boundary (the orbital distance at Mars's  Equivalent Radiation)
 : 1.376 AU ( 205912883.4 km) 

Snow Line      (the orbital distance at Snow Line Equivalent Radiation)
 : 2.025 AU ( 303009828.3 km) 



 (Habitable zone calculated based on SEAU(Solar Equivalent Astronomical Unit) around the star Kepler-77)
